com.fluidops.ajax.components

Class FMultiContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FComponent
      • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FContainer
        • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FMultiContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FEventListener

    public class FMultiContainer
extends FContainer
    Implements a "container host", which supports easy switching between several sub containers in the same place.
    Author:
    cp

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(FComponent c)
      adds a component registers it with the page pushes its HTML anchor tag to the end of the container DOM
      void remove(FComponent b)
      removes a component recursively unregisters it from the page
      void removeAll()
      Remove all registered components (non-recursive)
      void setActive(FComponent activeComp)
      Sets the specified sub component as the active component and refreshed the view immediately.
      void setActive(int i)
      Sets the active component by its number (in the order they where added, starting from 0) and updates the view immediately.

      • setActive

        public void setActive(FComponent activeComp)
        Sets the specified sub component as the active component and refreshed the view immediately. The component specified must have been add()'ed before or this method's behavior is unspecified. Initially, the last added component is assumed to be active.
        Parameters:
        activeComp -

      • setActive

        public void setActive(int i)
        Sets the active component by its number (in the order they where added, starting from 0) and updates the view immediately. The component specified must have been add()'ed before or this method's behavior is unspecified.
        Parameters:
        activeComp -
